results.title: Encounters of the spooky kind
results.creator_credit: Bo Ho Films, Raymond Chow and Samo Hung
results.brief_description: Encounters of the Spooky Kind, directed by icon of kung-fu cinema Samo Hung, has been credited with establishing the unique horror sub-genre of hopping vampire films, most vividly demonstrated by the Mr. Vampire series. A bizarre blend of slapstick, martial arts and the supernatural, this film follows the adventures of Cheung the Brave, an impoverished cart driver plagued by bad luck and a shrewish wife who is conducting an affair with his wealthy boss, Master Tam. After narrowly avoiding being caught one afternoon, Tam resolves to have Cheung eliminated by having a man dare him to spend a night in a haunted temple, and then paying Chin Hoi, a corrupt Taoist sorcerer, to raise a vampire to kill him. Cheung, unable to resist both a dare and the chance to prove his bravery, accepts, but is saved from certain death by his kung-fu skills and the advice of the sorcerer’s brother Tsui, who decides to help him defeat those who were plotting against him. Utilising his superior kung-fu abilities and a variety of vampire deterrents including chicken eggs, uncooked rice and a brew of dog’s legs and blood, he manages to ward off the vampire for a second night, only to be framed for the alleged murder of his wife. Escaping, Cheung finds himself caught up in a feud that eventually culminates in an explosive magical showdown between the warring brothers. As the evil incantations fly, Cheung, possessed by the spirit of the Monkey God, and Master Tam, possessed by the War God, are pitted against each other in a supernatural duel to the death. Stars Samo Hung as Cheung the Brave, Ha Wong as Master Tam, Lung Chan as Chin Hoi, and Fat Chung as Tsui. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Encounter Bay
results.creator_credit: S A Government Tourist Bureau and Geoffrey Shepherd
results.brief_description: Encounter Bay, where the Murray River enters the sea, has a colorful history of whaling stations and ship wrecks. Bleached bones, rusty anchors, and museums remain to testify. Now Victor Harbour, Port Elliot, and Goolwa are popular holiday resorts. Luxurious accomodation, miles of surf beaches, golf courses, and natural beauty have made it a playground for people of all ages.

results.title: Encounter at Kwacha House - Halifax
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Kemeny, Barrie Howells and Rex Tasker
results.brief_description: A vociferous discussion between black and white youths at the interracial club in Halifax, touching on racial discrimination in employment, housing, education and interpersonal relations.

results.title: Encore! : the best of Joan Sutherland
results.brief_description: Dame Joan Sutherland, Australian icon and declared National Treasure, has been described as the foremost soprano of our age and one of the greatest artists of all time. Live from the Sydney Opera House, performed by the Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra and conducted by Richard Bongyne, this video contains highlights of her stage performances with Opera Australia, including many of her most internationally famous and highly acclaimed roles.

results.title: Enchanted isles
results.creator_credit: Anglo-Scottish Pictures and Films of Scotland Committee
results.brief_description: A tour of the Hebrides, starting from Oban and crossing the water to Iona, St Columba’s Isle, and to Staffa and Fingal’s cave. The birthplace of Flora MacDonald and memories of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Also shows the industry and agriculture of the islands, including the weaving of Harris tweed.

results.title: Enchanted April
results.creator_credit: BBC Film Unit, Miramax Films, Greenpoint, Ann Scott and Mike Newell
results.brief_description: In a beautifully played ensemble piece four Englishwomen desert their dull and oppressive lives in post World War I London and escape to the Italian Riviera for a months holiday in a majestic castle. Once there, the castle and its magnificent surroundings work a special magic on the four women. Each find their worries slowly disappearing, their personalities changing and together, the four discover a friendship unknown to the likes of any of them before. Stars Miranda Richardson, Joan Plowright, Polly Walker and Josie Lawrence. From the novel by Elizabeth Von Arnim.

results.title: Encaustic by Karl Zerbe
results.brief_description: This film explains that encaustic - hot wax used as a binder for pigment - is an ancient painting technique revised by Karl Zerbe in the late 1930’s. Follows the artist in the various steps from the laying of a collage ground on bare masonite through the final touches of blowtorch to the surface of the finished painting.

results.title: Enameling art
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Robert Longini
results.brief_description: Indicates the basic practices common to this medium. Shows students at work enamelling on copper, with close-ups to demonstrate specific techniques.

results.title: En Toute Innocence = No Harm Intended
results.brief_description:
Paul Duchene runs an architecture practice with his son Thomas and Thomas’ wife, Catherine. One day, Paul finds Catherine in the arms of one of his assistants. Seething with rage, he drives off in his car and has an accident that leaves him crippled and mute. Failing a reconciliation, his daughter-in-law plans his murder.

Credits: Producer, Louis Duchesne ; director, Alain Jessua ; writers, Luc Beraud, Alain Jessua, Dominique Roulet ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Michel Portal.
Cast: Michel Serrault, Nathalie Baye, Francois Dunoyer, Suzanne Flon, Philippe Caroit.

results.title: En Normandie
results.brief_description: One of a series of teaching films with commentary in simple French. Illustrates the farm life of the province and then by contrast shows the industrial life concluding with several views of the two large ports, Rouen and Le Havre.
